questions.question_text: Which is a recommendation applying the guiding principle 'keep it simple and practical'?

discussion.content:
C. If a practice is easier to follow it is more likely to be adopted

The guiding principle "keep it simple and practical" recommends that organizations should strive to make their practices as easy to follow and understand as possible. One of the main recommendations of this principle is that if a practice is easier to follow, it is more likely to be adopted and used effectively. This means that organizations should aim to make their practices clear, straightforward, and easy to understand, rather than complex and difficult to follow. By doing so, they can increase the chances that their practices will be adopted and used effectively by those who need to use them.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C

5.2.7 monitoring and event management 

The purpose of the monitoring and event management practice is to systematically observe services and service components, and record and report selected changes of state identified as events. This practice identifies and prioritizes infrastructure, services, business processes, and information security events; it also establishes the appropriate response to those events, and conditions that indicate potential faults or incidents.
